Text: [The very first video shows us Altair with in a group of soldiers attacks the castle. After that the scene switches to a young girl talking to some Templar in the castle at the top of a high mountain.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Where are my ships, soldier? I was told there would be another fleet of eight.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: I'm sorry, Maria, but this is the best we could do.

Speaker: Maria
Text: It's barely big enough to hold our cargo! How do you propose to get the rest of us to Cyprus?

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Begging your pardon, but it might be better if you stayed in Acre.

Speaker: Maria
Text: What is that… a threat?

Speaker: Soldier
Text: It's fair warning. Armand Bouchart is Grand Master now, and he doesn't hold you in high regard.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Why you insolent… Very well, this ship is yours. I'll find my own way to Limassol.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Yes, M’Lady.
[He leaves.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Damn. I was a single heartbeat from knighthood. Now I'm little more than a mercenary.
[Suddenly, she's being attacked by Altair. He pushes her to the ground and puts a hidden blade to her throat.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Returned to finish me off?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Not just yet. I want information. Why are the Templars sailing for Cyprus?

Speaker: Maria
Text: It's been a long, dirty war, Assassin. Everyone deserves a holiday.

Speaker: Altair
Text: The more you tell me, the longer you live. So I'll ask again, why the retreat to Cyprus?

Speaker: Maria
Text: What retreat? King Richard has brokered a truce with Saladin, and your order is leaderless, is it not? Once we recover the Apple of Eden, you'll be the one running.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'll save my breath. The Apple of Eden is well hidden.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Altair, consider your options carefully. The Templars would pay you a great price for that relic.

Speaker: Altair
Text: They already have, haven't they?
[Maria is tied up and taken out of the castle.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: What's happening on Cyprus that would concern the Templars?

Speaker: Assassin
Text: Civil strife perhaps. Their Emperor, Isaac Comnenus, picked a fight with King Richard many months ago… and now he rots in a Templar dungeon.

Speaker: Altair
Text: A pity. Isaac was so easily bent, so willing to take a bribe.

Speaker: Assassin
Text: Ah, those days are past. Now the Templars own the island, purchased from the King for a paltry sum.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Ah! Well, that's not the kind of governance we want to encourage. Do we have any contacts there?

Speaker: Assassin
Text: I know of one in Limassol. A man named Alexander.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Send him a message. Tell him to expect me within the week.

Speaker: Assassin
Text: Yes, Altair.
[We're being moved into the future, where Altair writes down his memoirs.]

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: If there is good to be found in this artifact, I will discover it. But, if it is only capable of inspiring evil and despair, I hope I possess the strength to destroy it.
[We're going back to the present, to the port of Limassol… Altair leads Maria to the Assassin’s hideout.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: What if I just started screaming?

Speaker: Altair
Text: People would cover their ears and carry on. They've seen an unhappy slave before.
[In one of the alleys, they meet a man…]

Speaker: Man
Text: This port is off limits. Show your face!
[They're getting surrounded.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Nothing under this hood but an ugly, old Assassin.

Speaker: Man
Text: Altair.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Alexander… you got my message.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: I assumed it was a Templar trap. Who is the woman?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Templar bait. She was Robert De Sable's girl.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Don't belittle me, murderer. I'm a Templar too.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Unfortunately, she's a bit of a burden.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: We can hold her for you, Altair. We have a secure safehouse.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Good. I'm going to have a look around. I'll meet you there.
[At the safehouse…]

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Quite a ghost town, hm? People are afraid to leave their homes for fear of breaking some obscure new law. The Templars have never been interested in governing before. I wonder why now? I won't assume you're here out of charity. Can I ask your purpose?

Speaker: Altair
Text: It's a complicated story, but can be summed up easily: the Templars have access to knowledge and weapons far more deadly than anyone could have imagined. I plan to change this. One such weapon is in OUR hands; a device with the ability to warp men's minds. If the Templars possess mare like it, I want to know.

Speaker: Maria
Text: And we can certainly trust the Assassins to put the Apple of Eden to better use…

Speaker: Altair
Text: Where are the Templars holed up now?

Speaker: Alexander
Text: In Limassol Castle. But they're expanding their reach.

Speaker: Altair
Text: And how do I get inside?

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Kill the captain of the castle guard. With him dead, it's likely one of our spies would be promoted to the post. And if that happens, well, you can walk right in. It's a start.
[Altair kills the captain.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: It is done.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Good. Now find the Templar named Osman and tell him Alexander wishes his grandmother a joyous birthday. He will trust you then…

Speaker: Altair
Text: Where do I find him?

Speaker: Alexander
Text: The Cathedral square. He will be there soon. Osman thinks I'm coming to meet him, but you're the better man for this job.
[Altair finds the man.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Greetings Osman. Alexander sends his regards, and wishes your grandmother a joyous birthday.

Speaker: Osman
Text: Ah, the dear lady. May she rest in peace. Now, how may I help you friend?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Can you tell me why the Templars purchased Cyprus? Was it to set up another exchequer?

Speaker: Osman
Text: I don't rank high enough to know for certain, but I have heard talk, of an Archive of some kind.

Speaker: Altair
Text: An archive? Interesting. And who is the ranking Templar in Limassol?

Speaker: Osman
Text: A knight named Fredrick the Red. He trains soldiers in Limassol castle. A real brute.

Speaker: Altair
Text: With the castle guard dead, what would it take to get me inside?

Speaker: Osman
Text: Assuming lam appointed to his position, I could find an excuse to reduce the castle watch for a short time. Will that work?

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'll make it work.
[He returns to the safehouse.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Osman is making arrangements as we speak.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Excellent. Now what?

Speaker: Altair
Text: We give him some time. He also told me about the Templar Archive. Have you heard of such a thing?

Speaker: Maria
Text: Of course. That's where we keep our undergarments.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Cyprus would be a good location to safeguard both knowledge and weapons. With the right strategy, it's an easy island to defend.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Ah, if only our foolish Emperor had possessed such foresight. King Richard made short work of him…

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'll be back soon.
[He enters the castle and finds Fredrick in the field where he trains his soldiers.]

Speaker: Fredrick the Red
Text: No mercy, men! This is an island of superstitious heathens. Remember, they do not want you here, they do not like you, they do not understand the true wisdom of your cause! And they are scheming at every turn to cast you out! So stay on your guard, and trust no one!
[Altair assassinate Fredrick the Red and run off the Limassol castle. Running to the safehouse, he finds it on fire.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Maria isn't among the dead. So was she captured… or set free?

Speaker: Soldier
Text: He's fleeing! Don't let him escape!
[Altair runs away. Having climbed up to the roof, he hears Bouchart speaking to his subjects.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: A foul murder has shaken my order! Dear Fredrick the Red… slain! He, who served God and the people of Cyprus with honor, is paid tribute by a murderer's blade? Who among you will deliver those responsible to me?
[Everybody's standing in silence.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Cowards! You leave me no choice but to flush out this killer myself. I hereby grant my men immunity until this investigation is concluded.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Bouchart… The citizens are already restless. Perhaps this is not the best idea.
[Bouchart turns around, pulls out his sword and kills the soldier.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: If anyone else has objections. I invite you to step forward.
[A tied-up Maria runs out to the square.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Armand Bouchart!

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Who's that? Ah… An old colleague.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Bouchart! An Assassin has come to Cyprus! I managed to escape, but he cannot be far behind.

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Why Maria, that would make this your second miraculous escape from the Assassins, no? Once when De Sable was the target, and now here on my island…

Speaker: Maria
Text: I am not in league with the Assassins, Bouchart! Please listen!

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: De Sable was a weak-willed wretch. Verse 70 of the founding Templar Rule expressly forbids consorting with women…. for it is through women that the devil weaves his strongest web. De Sable ignored this tenant and paid with his life.

Speaker: Maria
Text: How dare you!

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Touched a nerve, did I? Lock her up.
[Altair finds her and saves her.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Get your hands off me! They consider me a traitor thanks to you.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I am only a convenient excuse for your wrath, Maria. The Templars are your real enemy.

Speaker: Maria
Text: I will kill you when I get the chance.

Speaker: Altair
Text: IF you get the chance… but then you'll never find the Apple of Eden. And what would curry more favor with the Templars right now? My head or that artifact?
[Maria doesn’t answer.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: I thought so…
[They meet up with Alexander.]

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Despite his bravado, Bouchart obviously took Maria's warning seriously. My sources tell me that after destroying our safehouse he immediately sailed for Kyrenia.

Speaker: Altair
Text: That's a shame. I was hoping to meet him. What's the fastest route there?

Speaker: Alexander
Text: By boat, definitely. But those pirates won't let you hop aboard one of their ships without good reason. Find a man named Pasha in the Ports. Tell him to honor the favor he owes me, and he might be able to get you on the next ship heading north.

Speaker: Altair
Text: You're a well connected man, Alexander.
[He meets Pasha in the Ports.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Alexander is calling in his favor, Pasha. He needs you to find me safe passage to Kyrenia.

Speaker: Pasha
Text: Ah, haha… you must be the resistance cutthroat I've heard stories about. Chasing down Armand Bouchart, are you? Armand and his precious cargo?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Cargo. Tell me more….

Speaker: Pasha
Text: Oh, I've just heard rumors. Holy artifacts of all kinds on these ships. For all I know he's got the Ark of the Covenant hidden somewhere nearby.

Speaker: Altair
Text: En route to the Templar archive, no doubt.

Speaker: Pasha
Text: Your guess is as good as mine. As for your transport… meet me on the docks later this afternoon and I'll see that you get safely aboard.

Speaker: Altair
Text: There will be two of us. We won't be late.
[Pasha leaves.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'm curious about this Templar Cargo. The ship's manifest might contain clues about what the Templars are bringing to their archive. I should have a look now before we set sail… before the ship is crawling with pirates.
[He goes down to the ship's quarters and finds the manifest.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: This manifest is a mess… a shoddy job done by lazy men… unless this is a deliberate attempt to hide something.
[In the next quarters, he manages to overhear a conversation…]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Where is that damned fool? Where is my First Mate?

Speaker: Sailor
Text: He's gone ashore, Captain.

Speaker: Captain
Text: In search of wine and women, eh? Listen: we sail for Kyrenia in two hours. If he's not back in one, he's off this ship. The Templars aren't paying me to play servant to a bunch of drunks.
[Altair goes back to Maria and Alexander.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: I found a ship headed for Kyrenia. We're leaving now.

Speaker: Maria
Text: If you expect me to behave while you drag me onto a boat full of pirates, you're mistaken.

Speaker: Altair
Text: If the pirates find you, they'll hand you over to the Templars for a handsome reward. Right back into Bouchart's hands.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: I wish you luck, Altair. Kyrenia is a rough place these days, but we have many friends in the city watch. Look for a man named Barnabas in the Commons district. I have not heard from him for some weeks, however, so you may be on your own.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Thank you Alexander. If I return to Limassol, I will report all that I have learned.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: By then we will have established ourselves in a new safehouse. Find us there.
[We’re back to old Altair and his memoirs…]

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: I struggle to make sense of the Apple of Eden… its function and purpose, but I CAN say with certainty that its origins are not divine. No… it is a tool… a machine of exquisite precision. What sort of men were they who brought this marvel into the world?
[Back to the present. Altair and Maria are sitting in the hold of the ship.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: That's a lovely ring….

Speaker: Maria
Text: It was a gift from Robert De Sable, when he took me under his wing. This is about all I have left of my ties to the Templars now….

Speaker: Altair
Text: Did you study philosophy, Maria?

Speaker: Maria
Text: I've read scraps… nothing more.

Speaker: Altair
Text: The philosopher Empedocles preached that all life on earth began simply, in rudimentary forms: hands without arms, heads without bodies, eyes without faces. He believed that all these early forms combined, very gradually over time, creating all the variety of life we see before us. Interesting, hm?

Speaker: Maria
Text: I don't see the point of your ramblings.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Only a mind free of impediments is capable of grasping the chaotic beauty of the world. This is our greatest asset.

Speaker: Maria
Text: But is chaos something to be celebrated? Is disorder a virtue?

Speaker: Altair
Text: It presents us with challenges, yes, but freedom yields greater rewards than the alternative. The order and peace the Templars seek requires servility and imprisonment.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Mmm. I know the feeling…
[Altair cuts the ropes on Maria's arms. We switch to two pirates standing in the distance.]

Speaker: Pirate
Text: I knew it was him. I told you!

Speaker: Pirate 2
Text: I'll bet the Templars would pays a pretty handsome reward for those two…

[The second pirate pulls out the sword. Meanwhile, Maria and Altair get out of the hold on the stairs. Maria kicks Altair and he falls into the hold. He manages to get out of the ship and find Maria. She stands with two men.]

Speaker: Man
Text: W-who's this? Stay where you are!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Thought I'd seen the last of you.

Speaker: Maria
Text: If only I were so lucky…

Speaker: Altair
Text: What is your business with this woman? Are you a Templar lackey?

Speaker: Man
Text: No sir. The pirates attacked her, and I had to help. But I'm no lackey. I can't stand these Templars.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I understand. You're not alone.

Speaker: Man
Text: My name is Markos, sir. I'll help in any way I can, if it means ridding my country of these crusaders.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Then I need you to keep this woman safe until I return. I have to find someone before the Templars do.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: We'll be patrolling the harbor all day. She'll be safe here with us.
[At the safehouse.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Barnabas?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: Eh? Yes… Who sent you?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Alexander of Limassol said I might find you here. I've been following Armand Bouchart.

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: Ah… Bouchart is in Kyrenia? He's probably visiting his prisoners in Buffavento.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Buffavento… is that a keep nearby?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: A castle, yes. It was once the residence of a wealthy Cypriot noblewoman, until the Templars seized her property.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Can you take me there?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: Well… I can do more than that, actually. I can get you inside, without the guards batting an eye. But you must do something for me first. For the resistance.

Speaker: Altair
Text: A familiar request. What is it?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: We have a traitor in our midst. A respected merchant by the name of Jonas. Eliminate him and I'll fulfill my end of the bargain.

Speaker: Altair
Text: It will be done.
[Altair finds and interrogate Jonas.]

Speaker: Jonas
Text: What's this, an Assassin? Does Saladin have his eyes on poor Cyprus too?

Speaker: Altair
Text: The Assassins have no ties to the Saracen. Our business is our own.

Speaker: Jonas
Text: Whatever the case, word of your presence is widespread and the Bull has put a bounty on your head… and the head of your female consort.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'm worth more and more every day.
[He assassinates Jonas.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Curious last words, Jonas. Still, you were helpful… if mercenaries are combing the streets searching for me and Maria, she won't be safe for much longer.
[Meanwhile, the pirates found Maria and Marcos. Altair introduces them to the value of his talents.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: The pirates, they jumped us! It was all so sudden.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Well, Maria. It seems there's a hefty price on both our heads.

Speaker: Maria
Text: A price? Goddamn Bouchart. He probably thinks I'm your bloody apprentice.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Someone called The Bull has dispatched his men to search for us.

Speaker: Maria
Text: The Bull? So they gave that Zealot his own parish?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Is he a friend of yours?

Speaker: Maria
Text: Hardly. His name is Moloch. He's a pious blowhard with arms like tree trunks.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Do you know the Resistance safehouse in the Commons?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: I know where it is, but I've never been inside. I'm just a foot soldier for the resistance.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I can't be seen with Maria, so you'll have to take her. Keep her out of sight, and meet me there when you're safe.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: I know some back alleys and tunnels. It may take longer, but we'll get her there in one piece.
[Altair returns to the safehouse.]

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: I just got word that someone found poor Jonas's body. What a waste, eh?

Speaker: Altair
Text: You knew him better than me. I'm sure he understood the risk of playing both sides.

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: Yes… unfortunately, this has complicated things. Jonas was a respected Cypriot and his death has sparked riots near the Old Church. The public is hungry for revenge, and to quell this, the Bull will call you out. You may lose the support of the resistance.

Speaker: Altair
Text: One death is enough to spark a riot?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: The Bull has been a cruel master, and unlike the Templars he actually believes what he preaches. He loathes our local faith, and even went so far as to steal a set of historic scrolls from us, claiming they were symbols of pagan blasphemy.

Speaker: Altair
Text: But Jonas was a traitor. Did the resistance not know?

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: Not enough of them, I'm afraid. The resistance is quite scattered.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Well, you'll have the chance to tell them yourself. Some men are on their way here now.

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: You're bringing people here? People you can trust?

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'm not sure who I can trust right now. But it's worth the risk. Right now I have to stop these riots from spreading.

Speaker: Barnabas
Text: And per our bargain, I'll see what I can do about getting you close to Bouchart. A deal's a deal, eh?
[Altair leaves the safehouse.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Agreeing to kill Jonas was rash, and until I find our more about Barnabas, I won't be running any more of his errands. Now, time to quell these riots before the Bull clamps down harder.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: What's going on out there? The city is in turmoil. I've seen riots.

Speaker: Altair
Text: The people are protesting the death of a citizen, a man named Jonas. Have you heard of him?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: My father knew him well. He was a good man. How did he die?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Bravely… Listen, Markos, things have gotten complicated. Before I find Bouchart, I need to eliminate The Bull and put an end to his violence.

Speaker: Maria
Text: You have quite a taste for chaos, Altair.

Speaker: Altair
Text: The Bull is one man responsible for the subjugation of thousands. Few will mourn his loss.

Speaker: Maria
Text: And you propose to just fly into Kantara, sting him, and exit unnoticed? He surrounds himself with devoted worshippers.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Kantara… that's to the East?

Speaker: Maria
Text: Yes, it's the most well defended… Forget it. You'll see.
[Altair infiltrates the castle and find the Bull.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Your tyranny ends here, Moloch!

Speaker: The Bull
Text: Oh no! It will continue. Beyond me, and you, and Bouchart… It will outlast us all.
[When Altair kills the Bull, the soldiers break into the room. Altair runs away from them and jumps from the castle wall in a small haystack. He manages to escape.]

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: Why do our instincts insist on violence? I have studied the interactions between different species. The innate desire to survive seems to demand the death of the other. Why can they not stand hand in hand? So many believe the world was created through the works of a divine power - but I see only the designs of a madman, bent on celebrating death, destruction, and desperation.
[Altair returns to the safehouse.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Altair, we were attacked! We tried to fight them off but, but… ah, it was no use.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Did they take Maria?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: I think so. They took everyone else… I wanted to stop them, but had to hide. There were too many.

Speaker: Altair
Text: This was not your fault. The Templars are crafty.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: I've heard they harness the powers of a Dark Oracle in Buffavento. That must be how they found us.

Speaker: Altair
Text: That's a curious theory, but I suspect it was Barnabas who tipped them off.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Barnabas? How can that be? The resistance leader Barnabas was executed the day before you arrived!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Before I arrived?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Altair, the Templars are preparing to execute our men. You must stop them!
[Altair finds at the execution site and kills the executioner by throwing a knife at his head and kills a bunch of solders around him.]

Speaker: Captain
Text: Assassin! There's an assassin here! Stop the Assassin!
[Altair finish off the rest of the solders, catches up with the captain and kills him by throwing a knife at his back. He goes back to the safehouse.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: I wasn't able to locate all of your men, Markos.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: They may still be imprisoned, either at the Harbor jail, or in Buffavento.

Speaker: Altair
Text: It would help to narrow that down. We don't have much time.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Many of the jailers like to drown their sorrows in the harbor district after a day's work. You may be able to find information there.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Still no sign of Maria?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: None. You think maybe she misses your company?

Speaker: Altair
Text: She might after she learns more about her old friends. Meet me later, outside the gates to Buffavento.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: You're not allowed here!

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: Are you threatening me? (hit the soldier]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: What's gotten into you?  Keep that up, and you'll pay dearly.

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: You don't even know how to use that thing.
[Altair kills the soldier and interrogate the tough guy.]

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: Coward! You want a fight, then show your face!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Forgive me Sergeant. It's the wine getting to me. You resemble the man who took my job.

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: Eh? Where were you posted?

Speaker: Altair
Text: I worked in the chapel at Buffavento, until Bouchart caught me drunk on wine.

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: Oh! Ha ha ha! Rough work around that old Oracle, eh? I'm working the Harbor prison, myself, keeping watch over those resistance scumbags.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Are they still there?

Speaker: Tough Guy
Text: Sure, and they ain't getting out. Just one Templar holds the key; a fella up at the crusader outpost. If he loses that set, those bastards'll rot in their cells.

Speaker: Altair
Text: We can't let that happen, can we?
[Altair assassinates the tough guy. He finds the jailer's key and release for the rest of the rebels.]

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Thank you, sir. May god bless you.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Was there a woman with you when you were taken?

Speaker: Rebel
Text: A woman? Yes sir, until the Bull's son Shalim took her away in chains. She didn't go quietly.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Hurry now. Return to your families!
[He goes back to Marcos.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Altair, I just heard the news. More of our brothers are free?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Yes. But Bouchart seems to have his eyes on every branch of the Resistance. Be wary.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: It's that Oracle! She sees everything! She's a menace, and must be stopped!

Speaker: Altair
Text: I don't know what this Oracle is telling the Templars, but if they were able to break the real Barnabas before he died, they may have broken her too.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Good god, do you suppose they tortured the poor man?

Speaker: Altair
Text: I think I'd like to have a talk with this Oracle myself.
[Altair sneaks into the castle. In the dungeons he manages to eavesdrop on the conversation between Armand Bouchart and Shalim.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: So the girl got away again, did she?

Speaker: Shalim
Text: I'm sure she had help. One minute she was chained up, the next she was gone…

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Don't insult me Shalim. Your weakness for women is well known. You let your guard down and she just walked away.

Speaker: Shalim
Text: I WILL find her again, Grand Master. I swear it.

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Do it quickly, before she leads the Assassin directly to the Archive. Oh and Shalim… see that this is delivered to Alexander in Limassol.

Speaker: Shalim
Text: Yes, Grand Master.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Alexander is working with the Templars too? My God, Bouchart has spies everywhere.
[After sneaking into the depths of the castle, Altair hears the sounds coming from somewhere…]
[Muttering and laughing) (More muttering and laughing]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: What's happening?

Speaker: Soldier
Text: It's that madwoman, sir. She's on a rampage… two of the guards are dead!

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Let her play. She has served her purpose.
[When Bouchart leaves, Altair walks into the Witch's quarters.]

Speaker: The Witch
Text: Pagan blood… I know your name, sinner… I know why you're here… God guide my claws… God grant me strength to snap your bones…
[After a short fight with a fast and dangerous opponent and her fanatical servants, Altair manages to defeat her.]

Speaker: The Witch
Text: Glory of God… I am his instrument… God's executioner… I fear no pain, nor death.

Speaker: Altair
Text: You were a Cypriot once, a respected noblewoman. What secrets did you tell those devils?

Speaker: The Witch
Text: Not without purpose do I deal in misery… by God's command, I am His instrument…

Speaker: Altair
Text: Whatever the Templars have done to you my Lady, they have done you wrong. Forgive me for this…
[Altair assassinate her and escape the castle.]

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: Who were The Ones That Came Before? What brought them here? What drove them out? What of these artifacts? Messages in a bottle? Tools left behind to aid and guide us? Or do we fight for control over their refuse, giving divine purpose and meaning to little more than discarded toys?
[Altair returns to the safehouse in Kyrenia Commons.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: The Oracle is dead. She won't be spilling any more secrets.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Ah, that is a great relief.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Who is Shalim? I overheard him talking to Bouchart earlier, discussing Maria. It seems they lost her.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Shalim is the Bull's whelp. A vicious man, though not so devout as his father. He's been seen with Bouchart on more than one occasion.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I think I'll tail him for a while, to see what I can learn.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Meet me in the Market district when you're through. I'd like to know what you've found.
[Altair finds Shalim at the market.]

Speaker: Shalim
Text: My father's been murdered, Soldier, and I'm in no mood to spend my own money on women. Why don't we spend a little of his?

Speaker: Shalim’s Guard 1
Text: Take a break. Shalim's orders.

Speaker: Shalim’s Guard 2
Text: You ugly wretch. A face like yours ought to be taxed!

Speaker: Woman
Text: Please, you've no right to do this!
[Altair silently kill the guards and continue to follow Shalim. Now the Bull’s son kill some poor fellow on the streets.]

Speaker: Shalim
Text: What's the take today, hm?

Speaker: Shalim’s Guard
Text: Not bad, Shalim. Enough to buy some wine and a bit of fun.

Speaker: Shalim
Text: I like the way you think, soldier. Let's go.
[He comes up to a drunk guy with a mug in one hand and a woman in the other.]

Speaker: Drunk Guy
Text: Raise a mug, Shalim!
[Shalim beats him.]

Speaker: Guy’s Woman
Text: Shalim, no! Please don't!

Speaker: Shalim
Text: Have your fun, men. And round up some local talent for me when you're finished.
[He's taking a woman away. Altair saves the Cypriots from Shalim's guards and returns to Marcos.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: You're right. Shalim is no gentleman. I just watched him tear through a brothel like a feral dog. Eh, he does that every week. No respect for anyone.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I need to get closer. If he's as stupid as he is brash, I may be able to get some secrets out of him.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Speak to one of the Monks near the Cathedral. Shalim's wayward lifestyle demands frequent confessions….

Speaker: Altair
Text: It's worth a try. Any sign of Maria?

Speaker: Marcos
Text: No, none at all. I do hope she's safe.

Speaker: Altair
Text: If she's safe, then we aren't, so stay alert.
[He goes to Crusader Outpost to find the Leader of the Scholars.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Does it not trouble you, brother, to suffer the sins of such a vile man as Shalim?

Speaker: The Leader of the Scholars
Text: It does, but to oppose him would mean death. The Templars have too much at stake here.

Speaker: Altair
Text: You mean the Archive. Can you tell me where it is?

Speaker: The Leader of the Scholars
Text: Hush. We can speak about this later.
[Meanwhile, Shalim, standing on the platform, addresses the people of the island.]

Speaker: Shalim
Text: Men and women of Cyprus! Armand Bouchart sends his blessing, but with a stern provision that all who foment disorder by their support of the Resistance will be caught and punished. But those who seek order and harmony, and pay obeisance to the Lord through good work, will enjoy Bouchart's charity! Now, let us work together as brothers to rebuild what hate and anger have torn down!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Strange. He's quite charitable this morning. Paying penance for his guilty conscience?

[After a while, Altair finds the Scholar again. He stops him with a hand gesture and dies under a pile of bricks. Altair notices the killer on the roof and starts chasing him but he vanishes in the thin air. Altair goes back to Marcos.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Altair… back so soon?

Speaker: Altair
Text: The Bull's son has a confused strategy for Cyprus… Abusing the population one day, and giving to charity the next.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: That's how the Templars keep us docile…. Building churches and giving to charity.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I need to catch Shalim when he's alone.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: You might try the harbor. Shalim likes to idle there whenever a ship full of exotic consorts arrives.
[Altair leaves and find Maria at the harbor.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Ahhhh. There you are, Maria. Clever lady… or damned foolish. If any of those guards stop her palanquin, they may recognize her. I'd better clear the path ahead.
[He kills the solders in Maria’s path. At the end she enters the castle of Saint Hilarion. Altair goes to assassinate Shalim.]

Speaker: Shalim
Text: Ah, I didn't expect to see you again. How can I help you, little fox?

Speaker: Maria
Text: I'm not here to be flattered. I want answers.

Speaker: Shalim
Text: Oh?

Speaker: Maria
Text: Is it true what I have heard, that the Templars wish to use the Apple of Eden for ill? Not to enlighten the people, but to subdue them?

Speaker: Shalim
Text: People are confused, Maria. They're lambs begging to be led. And that's what we offer: simple lives, free of worry.

Speaker: Maria
Text: But our order was created to protect the people, not rob them of their liberty.

Speaker: Shalim
Text: The Templars put no stock in liberty, Maria. We seek order, nothing more.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Order? Or enslavement?

Speaker: Shalim
Text: You can call it whatever you like, my dear. Assassin!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Apologies, Shalim. I let myself in.

Speaker: Shalim?
Text: You're looking for Shalim, eh? I'm sure my brother would be happy to join us.
[Apparently he has a twin brother. Maria's killing some of the guards who have come to the scene.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Two of them… and two of us.

Speaker: Maria
Text: (Snort contempt]
[She leaves. Altair assassinates the two brothers Shalim and Shahar, run off the castle and go to the safehouse.]

Speaker: Marcos
Text: It's happening. Altair. The ports are emptying of Templar ships. Kyrenia will be free. Maybe all of Cyprus!

Speaker: Altair
Text: Stay cautious. They wouldn't leave their archive undefended, so it cannot be here…

Speaker: Marcos
Text: Most of the ships that left here were headed back to Limassol. Could it be there?

Speaker: Altair
Text: Thank you, Markos. You have served your country well.

Speaker: Marcos
Text: God Speed, Altair.

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: I remember my moment of weakness, my confidence shaken by Al Mualim's words. He, who had been like a father, was revealed to be my greatest enemy. Just the briefest flicker of doubt was all he needed to creep into my mind with this device. But I vanquished his phantoms, restored my self confidence, and sent him from this world.
[Altair returns to Limassol and seeks new resistance safehouse in the local market.]

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Stay back, traitor! You have betrayed the resistance, and sold out our cause! Have you been working with Bouchart all this time?

Speaker: Altair
Text: I was about to ask the same of you, Alexander. I overheard Bouchart mention your name. He delivered a package to you, did he not?

Speaker: Alexander
Text: Yes. The head of poor Barnabas in a burlap sack!

Speaker: Altair
Text: This was not the man who met me in Kyrenia.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: What?

Speaker: Altair
Text: The real Barnabas had been murdered before I arrived, replaced by a Templar agent who did a good deal of damage before vanishing.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: God help us! The Templars have been equally brutal here, with Captains roaming the Market, the Ports, and the Cathedral square arresting anyone they see fit.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Don't despair. Kyrenia has already shaken off the Templars. We will expel them from Limassol too.

Speaker: Alexander
Text: You're right. But you must be careful. Templar propaganda has turned some of my men against you, and most others are wary.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Thanks for the warning.
[He goes to assassinate the Duelist Captain in the Market, then the Pirate Captain in the Port. After that Altair interrogates the Port Watchman.]

Speaker: Port Watchman
Text: Yeah I just got in yesterday. I'd rather be at sea than idling away in this dump. You know where I can find some entertainment, eh?

Speaker: Man
Text: Go away.
[Altair corners him and beats him up.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: I have a message for Armand Bouchart. Has he come through this port recently?

Speaker: Port Watchman
Text: I couldn't say. But he'd do well to avoid this place. We had some awful murders here last night.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Who was killed? Templars?

Speaker: Port Watchman
Text: No, a couple of my men working the docks. Cut down where they stood. It was so dark, nobody saw a thing.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Who was on duty that night?

Speaker: Port Watchman
Text: A goddamned Templar Sergeant. But you won't find him here, if you're looking.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I am.

Speaker: Port Watchman
Text: He's over by the Cathedral today. Praying for his own soul, hope…
[Now Altair is after the Patrol Sergeant.]

Speaker: Patrol Sergeant
Text: Kill him! Kill the Assassin!
[Altair kills his soldiers and beats the shit out of the Sergeant.]

Speaker: Patrol Sergeant
Text: Feeling brave, are we?

Speaker: Altair
Text: You cower like a man wracked with a guilty conscience.

Speaker: Patrol Sergeant
Text: You're getting desperate, Assassin. Attacking us blindly, grasping for answers.

Speaker: Altair
Text: You let Bouchart slip through the ports last night, and murdered two good men in the process.

Speaker: Patrol Sergeant
Text: That wasn't my work. I just patrol there. Go pester Demetris. He practically owns those ports.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Demetris? A wealthy man, I suppose…..

Speaker: Patrol Sergeant
Text: Oh quite! A debauched merchant and gluttonous worm. But he's been a useful ally in this operation.
[Altair assassinate the Sergeant.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: You can always judge a man by the company he keeps….
[He goes to the Marketplace to face the traitor.]

Speaker: Demetris
Text: Ah girls! Oh my lovelies! Spare an old man from his paltry imagination and let me gaze upon the reality of your beauty.
[Altair enters. The girls scream.]

Speaker: Demetris
Text: Eh? This isn't a public house, for God's sake! Remove yourself, pauper, before I call the guards!

Speaker: Altair
Text: I'm here on business, Demetris. I'm looking for one of your clients… a killer.

Speaker: Demetris
Text: What makes you think I know where to find such a man? I deal in textiles, not cutthroats.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Then what am I to make of the rumor that Bouchart hired you to sneak him through the ports this morning?

Speaker: Demetris
Text: Y-you're crazy. I would never work with that… that vile man.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Ladies…. Would you give us a moment?

Speaker: Demetris
Text: Please stop! What is it you want? I'll tell you everything. That damned killer, a Templar cutthroat. It was he who paid me to - Ahhh!
[He's falling to the floor. A dagger sticking out of his back. The killer from before jumps off the roof… Altair goes back to the safehouse but there’s no Marcos there.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: A note from Alexander… He's planning something in the castle courtyard. I'm not sure what this means, but it would be wise to be cautious.
[He finds Alexander at Limassol Castle Courtyard… dead.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Alexander…

Speaker: Man
Text: A friend of yours?

Speaker: Altair
Text: You… I didn't catch your name.

Speaker: Man
Text: What did I tell you in Kyrenia? Was it… Barnabas?
[A large crowd of people enter the courtyard.]

Speaker: Man
Text: There's the traitor!

Speaker: Woman
Text: String him up!

Speaker: Barnabas?
Text: Ah… sounds like public opinion has turned against you, Assassin.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Stop! I will not fight you. I am not your enemy!
[He's pulling out the Apple of Eden. It starts to glow.]

Speaker: Altair
Text: Armand Bouchart is the man responsible for your misery. He hired this man to poison the resistance against itself. Go from this place, and rally your men. Cyprus will be yours once again!

Speaker: Barnabas?
Text: Quite a toy you have there. Do you mind if I borrow it?
[Suddenly Maria pierces him with her sword, coming up behind him.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: So, you had it all along…

Speaker: Altair
Text: And now you see what kind of weapon it could be, in the wrong hands.

Speaker: Maria
Text: I don't know that I'd call yours the right hands.

Speaker: Altair
Text: No. Quite right. I will destroy it… or hide it. Until I find the archive, I can't say.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Well, look no further. You're standing on it.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Kill him! Kill the Assassin!

Speaker: Maria
Text: This way! Quickly!
[Altair defeat the ambush and goes after Maria.]
[Altair goes through the corridors of the Archives, destroying the crowds of Templar soldiers. In the middle, he finds Armand fighting Maria. Or, more precisely, not fighting, but beating her.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Witless Emperor Comnenus… he was a fool, but he was OUR fool. For almost a decade we operated in secret on this island. Our Archive was the best kept secret on Cyprus. Unfortunately, even the best laid plans were not immune to Isaac's idiocy.

Speaker: Altair
Text: He angered King Richard and brought the English a little too close for comfort. Is that it?

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Fortunately we were able to convince Richard to sell the island to us. It was the only way to divert his attention.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Purchasing what you already controlled…

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: And look where that has gotten us. Ever since you showed up and stuck your nose into too many dark corners, the Archive hasn't been safe.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I wish I could say I'm sorry. But I tend to get what I want.

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Oh, not this time. Assassin. Not now. Our little detour to Kyrenia gave us just enough time to dismantle the Archive and move it.

Speaker: Altair
Text: You weren't shipping Artifacts To Cyprus… you were shipping them OUT!

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Exactly. But not everything has to go… I think we'll leave you right here.
[Altair fights Armand Bouchart, the Templar Grand Master. In a long and fierce battle, Altair still manages to win.]

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Ah! You are a… a credit to your creed. Altair.

Speaker: Altair
Text: And you have strayed from yours.

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Not strayed… expanded. The world is more complicated than most dare admit. And if you, Assassin… if you knew more than how to murder, you might understand this.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Save your lecture on virtue for yourself. And die knowing that will never let the Apple of Eden fall into any hands but my own.

Speaker: Armand Bouchart
Text: Keep it close, Altair. You will come to the same conclusions we did… In time…

[He dies. Then, as in any self-respecting adventure, after the main villain's demise, his castle is start to crumble. Altair and Maria have exactly one minute to escape from the Archives. And, of course, they're doing it. They they go to the port.]

Speaker: Maria
Text: Everything I worked for in the Holy Land, I no longer want. And everything I gave up to join the Templars… I wonder where all that went, and if I should try to find it again.

Speaker: Altair
Text: Will you return to England?

Speaker: Maria
Text: No… I'm so far from home already, I'll continue on… East. To India perhaps. Or until I fall off the far edge of the world…. And you?

Speaker: Altair
Text: For a long time under Al Mualim, I thought my life had reached its limit, and that my sole duty was to show others the same precipice I had discovered.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Yes, I felt the same once.

Speaker: Altair
Text: As terrible as this artifact is, it contains wonders… I would like to understand it as best I can.

Speaker: Maria
Text: You tread a thin line, Altair.

Speaker: Altair
Text: I know. But I have been ruined by curiosity, Maria. I want to meet the best minds, explore all the libraries of the world, and learn all the secrets of nature and the universe.

Speaker: Maria
Text: All in one lifetime? It's a little ambitious…

Speaker: Altair
Text: Who can say? It could be that one life is just enough.

Speaker: Maria
Text: Maybe. And where will you go first?

Speaker: Altair
Text: East…

Speaker: Old Altair
Text: Our origins seem chaotic, unintended. With purpose and being instilled solely by the passage of time. Imposed by nature - and only later, by men. What should we do with this rare gift of life?
[When Altair finishes writing, Maria comes to him.]
